author: @ina__news
title: Abbas: The Zionist entity destroyed Gaza and is still committing crimes Â» Iraqi News Agency
text: Follow-up - INA Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas confirmed today, Thursday, that the Zionist entity has completely destroyed Gaza, and is still committing crimes, calling on the international community to impose sanctions against it. Abbas said in his speech before the UN General Assembly: "The Zionist entity has reoccupied the entire Gaza Strip and almost completely destroyed it, making it an uninhabitable place, after most of the homes, buildings, health and educational facilities, economic establishments, roads, churches, mosques, water and electricity stations, water treatment plants, and others were destroyed." Abbas added, "If the Zionist entity thinks that it will escape accountability and punishment for these crimes, it is delusional," calling on "the international community to immediately begin imposing sanctions on it." Abbas stressed that "the massacres, crimes, and genocide committed by the Zionist entity against our people since its establishment until today will not pass without accountability, and will not be subject to a statute of limitations, for no right is lost if someone demands it." â€œDespite our urgent and repeated demands, the world has not succeeded in forcing the Zionist entity to stop the genocidal war and war crimes against innocent civilians,â€ he continued, adding, â€œWe regret that the US administration has three times obstructed Security Council draft resolutions calling on the Zionist entity to cease fire by using its veto, and on top of that, it has provided it with lethal weapons that have killed thousands of innocent children, women and elderly people, which has encouraged the Zionist entity to continue its aggression.â€ [ Hezbollah declares bombing of a colony and a Zionist intelligence headquarters ](https://ina.iq/eng/35043-hezbollah-declares-bombing-of-a-colony-and-a-zionist-intelligence-headquarters.html) [ Antarcticaâ€™s 'doomsday' glacier is heading for catastrophic collapse ](https://ina.iq/eng/34876-antarcticas-doomsday-glacier-is-heading-for-catastrophic-collapse.html) [ PM: Pushing forward the relations between Iraq and Somalia is necessary ](https://ina.iq/eng/34979-pm-pushing-forward-relations-between-iraq-and-somalia-is-necessary.html)

author: Borja JimÃ©nez
title: Aviso naranja en Huelva por las malas previsiones: la DANA dejarÃ¡ lluvias de 30 litros por hora
text: Aviso naranja en Huelva por las malas previsiones: la DANA dejarÃ¡ lluvias de 30 litros por hora La DANA ha causado ya 1.677 incidencias en AndalucÃ­a desde el lunes Las previsiones sobre la DANA para la jornada de este viernes han empeorado en la provincia de Huelva La Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a (AEMET) ha activado el [aviso naranja](https://okdiario.com/sociedad/ultima-hora-dana-valencia-directo-muertos-desaparecidos-inundaciones-danos-riadas-13729977) por lluvias y tormentas para este viernes en la provincia de Huelva. Y es que en algunos puntos de la provincia onubense se espera que la [DANA](https://okdiario.com/andalucia/dana-cobra-primera-muerte-andalucia-hombre-pierde-vida-malaga-ser-rescatado-13734772) deje una lluvia de unos 70 litros en las primeras doce horas, en los que se alcanzarÃ¡n los 30 litros de agua en una hora. La [DANA](https://okdiario.com/andalucia/juanma-moreno-define-dana-como-emergencia-nacional-exige-coordinacion-marlaska-13740519), lamentablemente, no ha dejado de recorrer [AndalucÃ­a](https://okdiario.com/andalucia/cifras-dana-ejido-100-millones-euros-5-000-hectareas-cultivos-3-000-coches-13738839) mientras causa estragos en la Comunidad Valenciana. SegÃºn la web de la AEMET, ambas alertas de nivel naranja permanecerÃ¡n vigentes desde la medianoche de este jueves hasta el tÃ©rmino de la jornada de este viernes en la comarca de AndÃ©valo y Condado y el litoral onubense, mientras que el aviso del por tormentas cesarÃ¡ a las 18,00 horas de este dÃ­a. En estas zonas se espera una precipitaciÃ³n acumulada en una hora de 30 litros y de 70 en las primeras doce horas. Asimismo, el temporal activarÃ¡ la alerta amarilla por lluvias y tormentas desde el comienzo de esta madrugada hasta el fin de la jornada de este viernes Aracena, aunque la alerta por tormenta finalizarÃ¡ a las 18:00 horas del viernes. En esta zona se prevÃ© una acumulaciÃ³n de agua de hasta 20 litros y de 40 en las primeras doce horas. Casi 1.700 incidencias en AndalucÃ­a El temporal de lluvia y tormenta que azota a la comunidad andaluza desde el pasado lunes ha causado ya 1.677 incidencias en este territorio, ademÃ¡s las previsiones sobre la DANA para la jornada de este viernes han Â«empeoradoÂ» en la provincia de Huelva elevando la alerta a nivel naranja por fenÃ³menos meteorolÃ³gicos adversos que se activara a partir de esta medianoche. Desde el Puesto de Mando Avanzado ubicado en el Monasterio de La Cartuja en Jerez (CÃ¡diz), el consejero de la Presidencia, Interior, DiÃ¡logo Social y SimplificaciÃ³n Administrativa de la Junta de AndalucÃ­a, Antonio Sanz, ha subrayado que el paso de nivel amarillo a naranja en la provincia onubense, es una elevaciÃ³n Â«importanteÂ». En concreto el Servicio de Emergencias 112 AndalucÃ­a, ha registrado 521 incidencias en la provincia de CÃ¡diz, la mÃ¡s azotada por los efectos de las precipitaciones, seguida tras MÃ¡laga (475), Granada (222) y AlmerÃ­a (152). JaÃ©n con 51 incidencias, CÃ³rdoba con 31 y Huelva (15), paralelamente, son las menos afectadas por los efectos de las intensas precipitaciones. En la jornada de este jueves los efectos de la borrasca se han concentrado en la provincia de CÃ¡diz por la maÃ±ana, especialmente en los municipios de San Fernando y Chiclana por anegaciones de viviendas, garajes, acumulaciÃ³n de balsas de agua y lodo en calles y carreteras, y atasco de alcantarillas y la red de saneamiento pÃºblico. Ante la coincidencia de la pleamar con la descarga de escorrentÃ­as extraordinarias, se ha recomendado el alejamiento preventivo de las viviendas cercanas a la costa y se ha adelantado el horario de salida de los colegios. Durante la jornada de tarde, en cambio, solo se han producido notificaciones por balsas de agua en vÃ­as de Jerez de la Frontera, asÃ­ como en viviendas del paraje de Los Franceses-La Vega de Chiclana de la Frontera. A los Bomberos tambiÃ©n se les ha requerido para asistir a una persona atrapada en el interior de su coche, atrapado en una balsa de agua en la carretera CA-5101 en Arcos. En Sevilla, las Ãºltimas horas tambiÃ©n han discurrido sin incidencias relevantes, salvo acumulaciones de agua puntuales en carreteras de Utrera, El Viso del Alcor, Los Palacios y Villafranca y Montellano. Plan de emergencia en Huelva Asimismo, el consejero ha indicado que en la provincia de Huelva Â«se ha activado los planes de emergencia y se ha solicitado a los ayuntamientos que activen sus correspondientes planes para actuar con prevenciÃ³nÂ», al tiempo que ha seÃ±alado que Â«se estÃ¡n enviado los mensajes de responsabilidad y precauciÃ³n a la poblaciÃ³nÂ» en Huelva. Sobre la manga marina que se ha desencadenado en el municipio onubense de Isla Cristina en la jornada de este jueves, el responsable de Presidencia ha detallado que en torno a las 16,43 horas el Servicio de Emergencias AndalucÃ­a 112 recibiÃ³ varias llamadas alertando de Â«fuertes rachas de vientoÂ» en la zona de la playa. Este fenÃ³meno ha provocado Â«importantes destrozosÂ» en la zona costera pero tambiÃ©n en el municipio Â«con cubiertas y diferentes elementos de techo que han salido volando y ramas de Ã¡rboles caÃ­dasÂ». AdemÃ¡s, ha explicado que como consecuencia de este temporal se ha producido Â«un derrumbe parcial del techo de la piscina municipal en Isla CristinaÂ», lo que ha provocado que Â«una persona de 45 aÃ±os haya resultado herida en la pierna por la chapa del techoÂ». Este incidente Â«ha obligado a tener que intervenir rÃ¡pidamente, incluso con un torniquete, porque la herida era importanteÂ», ha aclarado Sanz, toda vez que ha seÃ±alado que la vÃ­ctima Â«ha sido trasladada al Hospital Infanta Elena y confÃ­o y deseo que todo evolucione favorablementeÂ». Carreteras El estado de la red secundaria de carreteras sigue afectado por los estragos del temporal, especialmente en la provincia de CÃ¡diz. A esta hora, presentan cortes, totales o parciales, una veintena en CÃ¡diz, siete en Sevilla y una en Granada. A lo largo de la tarde se ha procedido a la apertura de la MA-5505 y A-343 en Ãlora (MÃ¡laga), y al cierre de la SE-3200 en El Viso del Alcor (Sevilla) por el desbordamiento del arroyo Salado, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n se ha abierto la CA-6200 entre Paterna de Rivera y AlcalÃ¡ de los Gazules (CÃ¡diz). Hasta el momento, solo estÃ¡ activado el aviso amarillo por lluvias y tormentas en la provincia de Huelva desde el tÃ©rmino de esta jornada hasta la medianoche de este viernes, asÃ­ se eleva en la provincia onubense a naranja Â«riesgo importanteÂ» en Litoral, AndÃ©valo y Condado con una previsiÃ³n de precipitaciones de hasta 30 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora. La comarca de Aracena tan solo estarÃ¡ afectada por nivel amarillo. La fase de emergencia, situaciÃ³n operativa 1, del Plan de Emergencia ante el Riesgo de Inundaciones (PERI) se refiere a un fenÃ³meno que implica daÃ±os y por la que son puestas en prÃ¡ctica las medidas necesarias para el socorro y la protecciÃ³n de las personas o bienes. La situaciÃ³n operativa 1 la declara la persona titular de la ConsejerÃ­a con competencias en materia de protecciÃ³n civil y emergencias cuando la emergencia pueda controlarse mediante el empleo de los medios y recursos ordinarios disponibles en la Junta de AndalucÃ­a, o con apoyos puntuales de recursos cuya movilizaciÃ³n no requiera de una coordinaciÃ³n especÃ­fica por los Ã³rganos centrales del Sistema Nacional de ProtecciÃ³n Civil.

author: Voice of the Mirror
title: The Conservatives do not fit the bill - families are fed-up of sky high prices - Voice of the Mirror -
text:
Britain remains firmly in the grip of a cost of living crisis , despite what the Conservatives may claim.
Household bills for essentials are, on average, Â£326 more than they were a year ago. Food inflation is still averaging nearly 10% and rents and mortgages are set to rise again over the next 12 months. Yet wages are stagnant. From 1970 to 2007, salaries grew an average 33% each decade. Since the Tories came to power in 2010, they have flatlined â€“ a damning indictment of the partyâ€™s economic mismanagement.
The fall in inflation is welcome but with so many price rises, few people will even notice the difference. The Resolution Foundation think-tank reckons typical households here are now 9% poorer than their French counterparts. Low-income families are 27% poorer. Labourâ€™s first task, if elected, is to build an economy that works for all. A prosperous country can only be achieved if people can find secure work that pays them a fair wage.
Climate of fear The havoc caused by Storm Gerrit is a sobering reminder of the power of nature. The tornado which swept through Greater Manchester has damaged hundreds of buildings, ripping off roofs and blowing down walls. Elsewhere, homes have been flooded and travel disrupted. Every effort must be made to help those affected. We also need to be better prepared for severe weather events. What were once deemed to be freak Â­incidents are only going to become more frequent as a result of the climate crisis.
Grrreat escape A wildlife park is racing against time to reunite three one-year-old lion cubs saved from a Ukrainian zoo with their mum. The family of big cats will surely have pride of place in their new Yorkshire home if the dedicated staff pull off the rescue.

author: yahoo
title: Southend weather warning: Met Office hour-by-hour forecast | Echo
text:
Southend weather warning: Met Office hour-by-hour forecast Weather By Jessica Day-Parker @JessicaDayPark2 Digital Reporter Share Hour-by-hour forecast as Southend set for disruption amid strong wind warning (Image: Stock image / Met Office) Strong and gusty winds are expected to bring disruption to Southend this weekend as an 18-hour weather warning has been issued.
The Met Office has issued another yellow weather warning for wind, which is expected to cause delays across south Essex on Saturday and the early hours of New Year's Eve.
The forecaster says a "spell of strong and gusty winds will move east across England and Wales, bringing some disruption to travel and services" .
Residents and visitors are warned to expect some train and plane delays, as well as congestion on the roads, with journeys taking longer.
Low pressure will bring more wet and windy weather to the UK and warnings for heavy rain, strong winds and snow have been issued for this weekend âš ï¸
Latest info here ðŸ‘‰ https://t.co/QwDLMfRBfs
Stay #WeatherAware âš ï¸ pic.twitter.com/4cysjM1jry
â€” Met Office (@metoffice) December 29, 2023 It is also likely that some coastal routes, seafronts and coastal communities will be affected by spray or large waves, the experts predict.
Some short term loss of power and other services is also possible, and delays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges are likely.
Here the hour-by-hour forecast in Southend while the warning is in place:
Saturday 11am - Cloudy with gusts of 26mph 12pm - Cloudy with gusts of 27mph 1pm - Gusts pick up to 28mph 2pm and 3pm - Overcast as gusts of 28mph continue 4pm - Overcast with gusts of wind reaching 30mph 5pm - Cloudy with gusts of 33mph 6pm - Overcast again with gusts of 35mph 7pm - Cloudy with gusts of 36mph 8pm - Cloudy with gusts of 38mph 9pm - Overcast as gusts reach high of 39mph 10pm - Cloudy with gusts of 39mph 11pm - Cloudy with gusts of 38mph Sunday 12am - Overcast with 30 per cent chance of rain as gusts reach overall high of 40mph 3am - 90 per cent chance of heavy rain as gusts slow to 31mph Weather Share Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused.
Please report any comments that break our rules.

author: M3 Web - http://m3web.bg
title: The US Condemns Houthis for Abducting Bulgarian Sailors - Novinite.com - Sofia News Agency
text: [Winter Tourism: 1.8 Million Visit Bulgaria](articles/225820/Winter+Tourism%3A+1.8+Million+Visit+Bulgaria) Bulgaria has witnessed a bustling winter tourism season, with a total of 1.8 million tourists gracing its picturesque landscapes from December 1 to March 25 Barbara Leaf, the US Assistant Secretary of State for Middle East Affairs, criticized the Yemeni Houthis for their inhumane actions in capturing merchant ships, including the "Galaxy Leader", which holds two Bulgarian sailors. Leaf emphasized that such attacks on vessels unrelated to the Gaza conflict display recklessness and cruelty. The US has persistently urged the release of the ship and its crew through various channels, with the issue being a priority for special envoy Tom Landerking. Leaf underscored the urgency of allowing the captured sailors to return home to their families, labeling the situation as outrageous. Despite the Houthis' claims of solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza, Leaf asserted that their actions only harm innocent civilians and do not contribute to the Palestinian cause. The US has engaged with the Houthis for years, but dynamics shifted after the Houthis aligned themselves with the "axis of resistance" following Hamas's attack on Israel in October 2023. The plight of the Bulgarian sailors has garnered international attention, with the European Parliament drafting a resolution calling for their immediate release. Bulgarian MEPs Elena Yoncheva and Andrey Kovachev advocate for the resolution, which also addresses Iran's involvement in terrorist activities, including the 2012 bombing at Sarafovo airport in Bulgaria. The resolution calls for the designation of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a terrorist organization and demands heightened efforts for the safe release of all hostages, including those from the "Galaxy Leader". We need your support so Novinite.com can keep delivering news and information about Bulgaria! Thank you! In a testament to enduring friendship, this year marks the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Bulgaria and China Italy has thrown its weight behind Bulgaria's bid for full-fledged membership in the Schengen area, affirming its steadfast support during Italian President Sergio Mattarella's two-day visit to Bulgaria In a strategic move aimed at reinforcing Bulgaria's commitment to its European aspirations and tackling corruption, outgoing Prime Minister Nikolai Denkov held a crucial meeting with EU, Ukrainian, US, and British ambassadors In a statement that underscores the United States' keen interest in Bulgaria's political landscape, US Ambassador Kenneth Merten expressed disappointment at the failure of negotiations to form a government in the country Nathaniel Copsey has been appointed as the new British Ambassador to the Republic of Bulgaria, succeeding Rob Dixon, announced the British Embassy Bulgarian President Rumen Radev engaged in a telephone conversation with Indian President Droupadi Murmu, expressing heartfelt gratitude on behalf of Bulgaria UN Happiness Report: Bulgaria's Astonishing Leap in Rankings Bulgaria: 3 Regions With Lowest Life Expectancy - EU Report 2022
